posts.post_content: I have already attempted a blue/black control deck with this card. It pairs nicely with [underworld dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=underworld dreams). With Mind Sculpter and Liliana out, this deck is bonkers. Time Reversal, opponent loses 7 life, Liliana's tutor to find Time reversal, rinse and repeat. The biggest trouble I have had with the proxy is RDW. Replacing cancel with wall of frost makes for lots of RDW sadness in Type II.

posts.post_content:
I have a hilarious combo for this card, albeit a stupidly mana-intensive one. The thought of it amuses me nonetheless. Ingredients you will need: a [Venser's Journal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser's Journal), a [Consecrated Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consecrated Sphinx), and this card. You cast this, shuffle your hand and graveyard into your library, then draw 7 cards. Your opponent does the same. The Sphinx allows you to draw 2 cards for every 1 your opponent draws, so you draw another 14.
  
   
Congratulations! You are now the proud owner of a hand of 21 cards, none of which you have to discard, because of [Venser's Journal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser's Journal). If you have a [Leyline of Anticipation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Anticipation) on the battlefield you can pull this routine at the end of your opponent's go, then immediately gain 21 life on your upkeep. Hahaha.
posts.html:
I have a hilarious combo for this card, albeit a stupidly mana-intensive one. The thought of it amuses me nonetheless. Ingredients you will need: a Venser's Journal, a Consecrated Sphinx, and this card. You cast this, shuffle your hand and graveyard into your library, then draw 7 cards. Your opponent does the same. The Sphinx allows you to draw 2 cards for every 1 your opponent draws, so you draw another 14.

Congratulations! You are now the proud owner of a hand of 21 cards, none of which you have to discard, because of Venser's Journal. If you have a Leyline of Anticipation on the battlefield you can pull this routine at the end of your opponent's go, then immediately gain 21 life on your upkeep. Hahaha.

posts.post_content:
If i'm not mistaken they already [once tried](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=49055) to make a balanced version of [Timetwister](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timetwister).
  
Yet the cost of ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) for [Temporal Cascade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Temporal Cascade) appeared to be a bit overcautious to me.
  
But then again, this card was possibly just *inspired* by Timetwister since both effects were seperated there and would only get combined by paying further ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) for the entwine cost.
  
   
However, *this* remake certainly appears more interesting and playable.
  
   
(On a side note, Evo Ragus seems to mix up pessimism and realism.)
posts.html:
If i'm not mistaken they already once tried to make a balanced version of Timetwister.
Yet the cost of for Temporal Cascade appeared to be a bit overcautious to me.
But then again, this card was possibly just inspired by Timetwister since both effects were seperated there and would only get combined by paying further for the entwine cost.

However, this remake certainly appears more interesting and playable.

(On a side note, Evo Ragus seems to mix up pessimism and realism.)

Posted By: LTJZamboni (7/10/2010 8:07:43 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'd use Time Spiral instead if format isn't an issue. As DonRoyale said there, your opponent got to use his seven new cards first. Time Twister was such a bomb partly because 1) You can reuse it, 2) It only costs three hence give much more room for your own combos. Time Spiral, for one extra, untap six lands you control. Time Warp gives you the extra turn, which means extra untap.  
  
Time Reversal is still a good card, of course. Anything gives you seven new cards is potentially deadly. In late game, perhaps the five CMC would be more forgiving.  
  
4/5
posts.html:

Time Twister was such a bomb partly because 1) You can reuse it, 2) It only costs three hence give much more room for your own combos. Time Spiral, for one extra, untap six lands you control. Time Warp gives you the extra turn, which means extra untap.

Time Reversal is still a good card, of course. Anything gives you seven new cards is potentially deadly. In late game, perhaps the five CMC would be more forgiving.

4/5
